intro: Vausagesia bellidifolia, commonly known as the bellidifolia acanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive palmate shape and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Vausagesia bellidifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and showy blossoms. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
